questions.text: The high court has power to put a stay to the execution of a pregnant woman according to which section of criminal procedure code?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - 416 Cr.P.C. Ref.: Criminal Procedure Code Explanation:If a woman sentenced to death is found to be pregnant, the High Court shall order the execution of the sentence to be postponed, and may, if it thinks fit, commute the sentence to imprisonment for life. Amendment: In section 416 of the principal Act, the words "order the execution of the sentence to be postponed, and may, if it thinks fit" shall be omitted. That read as – “If a woman sentenced to death is found to be pregnant, the High Court shall commute the sentence to imprisonment for life”.

questions.text: According to Criminal law amendment act 2013, the minimum age of a girl to give valid consent for sexual intercourse is
questions.solution: Ans.:B - 18 years Ref.: Criminal law (amendment) act 2013 Explanation:Previously the minimum age of agirl to give consent for sexual intercouse was 16 years. After this ammendment act, it is raised to 18 years.

questions.text: Mr.X fired his gun at Mr.Y who moved and escaped from fatal injuries with the bullet only grazing his thigh. There was only a little bleeding and no other significant injury. Mr. Y registered a F.I.R. against Mr.X. Mr X is liable for punishment under which section of Indian Penal Code?
questions.solution: Ans.:C - 324 Ref.: Section 324 of I.P.C. Explanation: Sec. 324 of IPC deals with voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means.

questions.text: Lowest two parts of the sternum fuses by what age?
questions.solution: Ans.:B – 14 years Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 71 and 77 Explanation:The four pieces of the body of the sternum fuse with one another from below upwards between 14 to 25 years. At about 40 years, the xiphoid unites with the body. The manubrium fuses with the body in old age at about 60 years.

choices.text: Seat best abrasion over left shoulder

questions.text: Two dead bodies are found outside the car following an accident. The doctor conducting the autopsy was able to differentiate between driver and front seat passenger based on all of the features except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Sparrow feet marks Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 13 Explanation: Steering wheel impact is seen only in driver. Whiplash injury may be seen in both driver and passenger, but it is less common in driver.Seat best abrasion over left shoulder indicates that he is front seat passenger. But Sparrow feet marks may be seen in both driver and front seat passenger and the chances of sustaining sparrow feet marks are equal.

choices.text: Ring fracture of foramen magnum+ Lumbar spine injury
Pond fracture skull + cervical spine injury
Gutter fracture skull + cervical spine injury
Depressed fracture skull + cervical spine injury

questions.text: A man fell from 35 feet height . Eyewitnesses say that he landed directly on his feet. Which of the following injuries will confirm this fact?
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Ring fracture of foramen magnum+ Lumbar spine injury Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 231 Explanation: Fall from height on feet or buttocks give rise to ring fracture and lumbar spine injury due to the force transmitted through the tibia, femur and spine.

choices.text: Injuries maybe due to burns or air blast
Force of explosion is mostlly directional
Bruise, laceration and abrasions are triad of main injuries seen

questions.text: A bomb blast took place in delhi following which two persons died . All of the following are true about these types of injuries except
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Force of explosion is mostlly directional In a typical open-air explosion, such as a high-order detonation, the blast wave propagates radially — that means it spreads equally in all directions from the point of detonation, forming a spherical or cylindrical shock wave. The primary blast force in such cases is non-directional by nature and follows the physical laws of pressure wave propagation. The intensity of the force decreases rapidly with increasing distance from the center — a well-established principle in blast physics. In case of bomb blast the force of explosion decreases rapidly. The injuries may be due to burns or air blast (Shock waves and blast wind). Bruises, lacerations and abrasions are the main injuries (Marshal’s triad) seen in case of bomb blast. The force of explosion is concentrical and not directional..

questions.text: Rat-hole injury is associated with which type of injury?
questions.solution: Ans.:B - Firearm Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 205 Explanation: In case of smooth bored firearms (shotguns) at a range between 30 cm and 1m, the rim of the wound is irregular and shows some scalloping, often referred to as a rat hole. There may be annular abrasions and bruising or “rat nibbling” from its resemblance to rodent teeth marks.

questions.text: The 'knot' in judicial hanging is placed at:
questions.solution: Ans.:B – The angle of jaw Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 323 Explanation: In case of Judicial hanging the knot is placed under the angle of right jaw.

questions.text: Segmentation of blood vessel after death is called as
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Kevorkian sign Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 145 Explanation: Fragmentation or segmentation of the blood columns in the retinal vessels appear within minutes after death and persists for about an hour after death; known as rail road phenomenon or trucking or shunting or Kevorkian sign.

questions.text: Acrid pear like smell is seen with
questions.solution: Ans.:D – Chloral hydrate Ref.: Pillay VV, TB of FMT, 18th Ed. Page No. 510 Explanation: BothChloral hydrate and paraldehyde give rise to Acrid (pear-like) smell. But if both options are there, better to opt for Chloral hydrate.

choices.text: The doctor is not guilty because of contributory negligence.
Doctor is guilty under last clear chance doctrine.
Doctor is guilty under avoidable circumstances.
Doctoris is guilty as he perscribed wrong medicines.

questions.text: A person was advised by his orthopedician to get regular dressing of his wound done. But the patient did not give care. The patient visited after sometime at which time the orthopedician again advised regular dressing but did not do the dressing himself as he said he was busy. Finally the wound enlarged and the underlying bone developed osteomyelitis. Which statement is true?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) -The concept of "contributory negligence" applies when the plaintiff's own negligence contributes to their injury or damages. In this case, the patient's failure to follow the doctor's advice and get the dressing done on time resulted in the worsening of the wound and later development of osteomyelitis. Therefore, the patient should be considered to have contributed to their own injury. The "last clear chance" doctrine is a legal principle that applies to cases of contributory negligence, where both the plaintiff and defendant were negligent, but the defendant had the last clear chance to avoid harm. However, in this situation, the doctor did not have the last clear chance to prevent harm, as the patient had the opportunity to take care of the wound by getting the dressing done on time

questions.text: Sweating is absent in
questions.solution: Ans.:A – Heat stroke Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 296 Explanation: In case of heat stroke the temperature raises to 400 to 430 C or more. The skin is dry, hot and flushed with completw absence of sweating.

questions.text: A doctor who has performed the autopsy on a 26- years old married women who has committed suicide found the cause of death to be due to aluminium phosphide poisoning. He was summoned in a court of law where he willingly hides this information. This is punishable under which section?
questions.solution: Ans.: A. - IPC 193 Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 13 Explanation: Section 193 IPC - Punishment for false evidence (Perjury), i.e. wilful lie under oath.

questions.text: Which of these findings is not specific of blast injury?
questions.solution: Ans.: D. Fracture Ref.: Anil Aggrawal, APC FMT for Ayurveda, Page 223 Explanation:Small missiles striking the body produce the classic triad of punctate lacerations, abrasions and Bruises (Marshall Triad). This triad is very characteristic of bombings.

questions.text: Shoe polish smell is seen in?
questions.solution: Ans.: D. Nitrobenzene Ref.:RabindraNathKarmakar: FMT: Theory, oral & practical, page 71 Explanation: Nitrobenzene is yellow-brown liquid which smells like shoe polish.

questions.text: Which acid does not show coagulation necrosis on contact?
questions.solution: Ans.: C. HF Ref.: George G.A. Pujalte, Primary Care Dermatology, An Issue of Primary Care: Clinics in Office.Page. 596 Explanation: With the exception of hydrofluoric acid, acids release hydrogen ions and producecoagulation necrosis that results in eschar formation limiting the depth of the burn.

questions.text: Boiled lobster appearance is seen in poisoning of?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Boric acid Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 499 Explanation: In boric acid poisoning the major symptoms are desquamation, erythema and exfoliation giving a boiled lobster appearance of skin.

questions.text: An autopsy was performed on a case of accidental death. It showed two linear fractures on petrous part of temporal bone. Which of the following rules gives the sequence of fractures?
questions.solution: Ans.: B -Puppe’s rule Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 213 Explanation: Puppe’s rule is used to determine the sequence of injury in case of multiple impacts. It states- ‘A fracture line does not cross the already existing fracture line’.

questions.text: Ashley rule is for determination of what?
questions.solution: Ans.: B - Sex Ref.: Anil Aggrawal, APC FMT for MBBS, Page 52 Explanation: Ashley’s rule of 149 is used to determine sex. Total length of manubrium and body of sternum is >149 in males, whereas it is <149 in females.

choices.text: Growth at the site following trauma
Age related changes in the teeth

questions.text: Ewing postulates concerns with which of the following:
questions.solution: Ans.: A. Growth at the site of following trauma Ref.:KrishanVij, TB of FMT, 5th Ed, Page 106 Explanation- Ewing postulates gives certain criterion which must be satisfied before the relationship between trauma and new growth is accepted.

choices.text: Coagulation necrosis occurs at the site of burn

questions.text: A man throws sulfuric acid on the face of his wife after a fight following which she comes to the emergency for supportive management. All of these statements are true about chemical burns except:
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Blisters are present Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 298 Explanation- Vesicles and blisters are absent in case of chemical burns by acids or alkali.

questions.text: Most common mode of suicide in India is:
questions.solution: Ans.: D – Hanging Ref.:National Crime Record Bureau Explanation: As per national crime record bureau (NCRB) report, the most common mode of suicide in India is hanging.

choices.text: Polyvalent anti snake venom is effective in Pit Viper bite
Atropine premedication should be used before administering Neostigmine.
Neostigmine has a role in Krait bite

questions.text: Which of these statements is false statement about snake bite?
questions.solution: Ans.: D - Neostigmine has a role in krait bite Ref.: https://www.scribd.com/document/261619089/Critical-Care-Emergency-Medicine-03 Explanation: Neostigmine is an anticholinesterase, which is particularly effective in postsynaptic neurotoxins such as those of cobra and is not useful against presynaptic neurotoxin i.e. common Krait and the Russell’s viper.ASV produced by Hoffkine Biopharmaceutical Company neutralizes venom of trimeresurus species due to paraspecific activity.

questions.text: In examination of victim of sexual assault, toluidine blue dye test is done to identify-
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Recent micro injuries Ref.:Effects of toluidine blue and destaining reagents used in sexual assault examinations on the ability to obtain DNA profiles from post coital vaginal swabs.J Forensic Sci. 1997 Mar;42(2):316-9. Explanation:Toluidine blue stains nuclei and is used to identify micro-lacerations of the keratinized squamous epithelium that are not apparent on gross visualization.

questions.text: Which of the following principles given biomedical research in human subjects:
questions.solution: Ans.:B - Helsinki declaration Ref.: The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, KSN Reddy, 34th Edition, Page No. 600 Explanation:WMA drew up a Code of Ethics on human experimentation in 1964 which was revised in 1975.

questions.text: According to transplantation of human organs Act, which of the following doctors are not authorized to declare brainstem death:
questions.solution: Ans.:D - Surgeon doing liver transplant Ref.: THE TRANSPLANTATION OF HUMAN ORGANS ACT, 1994 and Transplantation of Human Organs (Amendment) Act 2011 Explanation:Brain-stem death should be certified by a Board of medical experts consisting of the following namely: (i) The registered medical practitioner (RMP) in charge of the hospital in which brain-stem death has occurred; (ii) An independent RMP, being a specialist, to be nominated by RMP specified in cause (i) (iii) A neurologist or a neurosurgeon to be nominated by the RMP specified in clause (i) (iv) The RMP treating the person whose brain-stem death has occurred.

questions.text: 2 year old child suffers flame burns involving face, bilateral upper limbs and front of chest and abdomen. What is the body surface area involved
questions.solution: Ans.: C. 40% Ref.: Lund and Browder chart Explanation: Bilateral upper limbs (10+10), front of chest and abdomen (13) and face (7%) that makes the total of 40%.

questions.text: Finger printing finder involves recording prints of 8 fingers. Which finger pair is excluded?
questions.solution: Ans.:C - Little finger Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 84 Explanation: Fingerprint reader (FINDER), is a computerized automatic fingerprint reading system which can record each fingerprint data in half a second. Prints of 8 fingers are recorded except little finger.

choices.text: Change in specific gravity of lungs
Presence of air in stomach and duodenum

questions.text: In assessing infant deaths,Plocquet’s test involves-
questions.solution: Ans.:C - Change in weight of lungs Ref.:Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 411 Explanation:Plocquet’s Test: The ratio between the weight of the lung and body is 1:70 before respiration and 1:35 after respiration.

questions.text: After a building collapse, among remnants a person’s length of humerus is 24.5 cm. What is the predicted height of the person?
questions.solution: Ans.: B. 130 cm. Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 606 Explanation: Multiplication factor for humerus is 5.3. So when 24.5 is multiplied by 5.3 it comes 129.5, rounded to 130 cm.

questions.text: What is the predicted bone age from the wrist radiograph given below?
questions.solution: Ans.:C. < 15 years Ref.: Anil Aggrawal, TB of FMT, Page No. 83 Explanation: In this X-ray, pisiform is not appeared (which appears at 9-12 years), so the age is less than 12 years. So, best answer here is <15 years.

questions.text: What does this picture depict?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Pugilistic attitude Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 300 Explanation: Pugilistic attitude is due to heat stiffening, i.e., coagulation of muscle proteins, which causes contraction. Seen in both in antemortem and postmortem burns. It occurs whether the person was alive or not at the time of burns. Heat stiffening is due to exposure of the body to temperature above 650C. It is seen in those dying due to bums and sudden immersion in boiling liquid. In heat stiffening, body assumes a posture of generalized flexion. The body is flexed at all the joints except over the back.

questions.text: The following patient has what type of injury in the right posterior part of shoulder?
questions.solution: Ans.:D - Chop wound Ref.:Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed, Page No. 186 Explanation: In case of chop wounds, the margins are regular and edges are abraded or contused.

questions.text: The Following is victim of firearm injury. What is the suspected distance of the shot?
questions.solution: Ans.: B - Intermediate Range Ref.: The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, KSN Reddy, 34th Edition, Page No. 212 Explanation: In this picture, there is wound of entry with tattooing which indicates that the range is beyond the reach of the smoke, but within the reach of the powder particles, i.e., Intermediate range.

questions.text: St. Anthony’s fire refers to poisoning by?
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Ergot alkaloids Ref.:The War of the Soups and the Sparks: The Discovery of Neurotransmitters and the dispute over how nerves communicate, Elliot S., Page No. 40 Explanation: Ergotism is an intensely painful burning sensation in the limbs and extremities caused by ergotamines from a fungus (Clavicepspurpurea) that can contaminate rye and wheat.

questions.text: The following patient was brought for an autopsy. What is the cause of the discoloration of the region pointed by the arrow?
questions.solution: Ans.:B - Sulfhemoglobin Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 157 Explanation: The veins converging on the root of the neck. The superficial veins especially over the roots of the limbs, thighs, sides of the abdomen, shoulders, chest and neck are stained as bluish or greenish lines due to staining of the veins by Sulfhemoglobin, known as marbling. It becomes prominent in 36-48 hours.

questions.text: A doctor used the same needle used in a patient with HIV to inject in another patient. The latter patient on testing found to be infected with HIV. The doctor is punishable for this negligence according to which section of Indian penal code?
questions.solution: Ans. D - Section 269 Ref.: Indian Penal Code Explanation: Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease danger­ous to life.—Whoever unlawfully or negligently does any act which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, likely to spread the infection of any disease dangerous to life, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine, or with both.

choices.text: Singeing of eyebrows and facial hair
Blackish soot deposit on posterior part of tongue

questions.text: A 38-year-old female presented to the emergency room with extensive burns. The patient had grade 3 burns on the face, back upper arms and forearms along with singeing of hairs. Which of these is not a proof of inhalation burns?
questions.solution: Ans.:B - Singeing of eyebrows and facial hair Ref.: https://emedicine.medscape.com/article/771194-overview Explanation: By definition, inhalation injury is injury to the oropharynx, nasopharynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs from exposure to smoke or heated gas. Soot deposit is due to the inhalation. Nitrogen dioxide liberated during burns may convert sputum into yellow. Mucosal injury may cause hoarseness and stridor. Singeing will not happen by inhalation.

questions.text: A 19-year-old patient presented to the emergency with altered sensorium. A non-contrast CT revealed hydrocephalus, requiring urgent neurosurgical intervention. The patient had nobody accompanying him or any identity proof. Under which of these sections of Indian Penal code can the neurosurgeon perform the procedure without obtaining an informed consent from a guardian?
questions.solution: Ans.: D. Section 92 Ref.: Indian Penal Code Explanation:Nothing is an offence by reason of any harm which it may cause to a person for whose benefit it is done in good faith, even without that person’s consent, if the circumstances are such that it is impossible for that person to signify consent, or if that person is incapable of giving consent, and has no guardian or other person in lawful charge of him from whom it is possible to obtain consent in time for the thing to be done with benefit.

questions.text: All of these are suggestive of domestic violence in a child except:
questions.solution: Ans.:D. Wormian bones Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 417,418 Explanation:Wormian bones are a subset of the small intrasutural bones that lie between the cranial sutures formed by the bones of the skull vault. The title Wormian bones is reserved for abnormal intrasutural bones that are typically found around the lambdoid suture.

questions.text: An abandoned dead male fetus was found and brought by police for autopsy. The following was the report “The head to feet length is 35 cm, Eyes are open, Pupillary membrane is absent, Crown Rump Length is 23 cm, tested are at the superficial inguinal ring and weight of the fetus is 1000 Gm. “ What is the estimated age of the fetus?
questions.solution: Ans.: C - 7 months Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 81 Explanation:At 7 months, Length: 35 cm, Crown –rump length: 23 cm, Foot length: 8 cm, Weight: 900-1200 gram. Skin is dusky red, thick and fibrous and covered with vernix. The eyelids are separated, pupillary membrane disappeared, scalp hairs are about 1 cm long and nails thick and up to fingertip. Meconium in descending colon, left testes near the external inguinal ring and right near the internal inguinal ring.

questions.text: Correctly match the following:
questions.solution: Ans. B - 1-ii,2-iii, 3-iv, 4-i Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 600

questions.text: A farmer ingested some unknown poisonous seeds and had pain and vomiting. Soon he developed paralysis of his lower limbs which ascends till it affected the respiratory muscles and he died within two days. Identify the likely cause:
questions.solution: Ans.:B - Conium maculatum Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 571 Explanation: Conium masculatum in also known as Hemlock, contains mainly coniline which is a peripheral nerve poison. It causes burning in mouth and throat, vomiting, diarrhoea, slow respiration, increased and later slow pulse, mental confusion, tremors, ataxia, sometimes blindness, progressive motor paralysis extending upwards from the extremities, coma and death from respiratory paralysis.

choices.text: Atropine should be administered till signs of recovery

questions.text: A lady is brought from village, unconscious, about 12 hours after ingesting some kind of unknown poison. Her heart rate is 103/min, blood pressure in 90/50 mm Hg and respiratory rate is 19/min. Her breath smells like kerosene. All of the following should be done in her management, except:
questions.solution: Ans.:A. Gastric lavage should be done Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 571 Explanation: Signs and symptoms are of OP poisoning including smell of kerosene. Gastric lavage is useful anytime within 3 hours after ingestion of a poison. (But lavage can be done up to 12 hours after ingestion in poisoning by tricyclic antidepressants, salicylates, antihistamines, phenothiazines)

choices.text: Breadth of first sacral vertebra x 100 / breadth of fifth lumbar vertebra
Breadth of fifthlumbar vertebra x 100 / breadth of all sacral vertebra
Breadth of first sacral vertebra x 100 / breadth of base of sacrum
Breadth of fifthlumbar vertebra x 100 / breadth of base of sacrum

questions.text: Which of the following is correct regarding corprobasal index of sacrum?
questions.solution: Ans.: C. Breadth of first sacral vertebra x 100 / breadth of base of sacrum Ref.: The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, 34th Edition, KSN Reddy, Page No. 62 Explanation: Corporo-basal (CB) index is used to differentiate the sex by sacrum

choices.text: Upper third molar is most commonly absent in Mongolians
In negroes the cusps of molars are wide and deep and shovel shaped cusps in incisors
Prominent lingual ridge and labial ridge in Mongols

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct regarding teeth features and ethnicity?
questions.solution: Ans.: B. In Negroes the cusps of molars are wide and deep and shovel shaped cusps in incisors Ref.: RickneScheid, Woelfel’s Dental Anatomy (8thEdn), Pg. 62, 361/Benard Knight, Knight’s Forensic Patholgoy (4thEdn) Pg. 559 Explanation: A congenital lack of the third upper molar is most common in Mongoloids. Shovel-shaped incisor teeth has prominent marginal ridges and a deep fossa on their lingual surfaces, which is usually observed in Mongoloid people. Cusp of Carabelli (an additional cusp) on a maxillary first molar is present in Caucasoids.

questions.text: A young adult came with casualty with history of some substance abuse. His pulse was 110 beats per minute, respiratory rate 30/min, blood gas analysis revealed metabolic acidosis, hypocalcemia and electrolyte imbalance. Blood urea – 100 mg/dl, creatinine – 3.4 mg/dl. Urine analysis showed calcium oxalate crystals. He improved on gastric lavage, ethanol, sodium bicarbonate, calciumgluconate and 4-methyl pyrazole. What is the substance he consumed?
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Ethylene glycol Ref.: V.V. Pillay; Modern Medical Toxicology, Page No. 196 Explanation:Ethylene glycol; also called antifreeze. It is a clear, colorless, odourless, non-volatile liquid with a bitter-sweet taste. MOA – Toxicity through metabolites, i.e. glycolic and oxalic acids which inhibit oxidative phosphorylation. CLINICAL FEATURES • Tachycardia, tachypnoea and congestive heart failure • Hypocalcemia, electrolyte imbalance and metabolic acidosis (due to glycolic acid) • Oxaluria, acute tubular necrosis, renal failure and Calcium oxalate crystals (due to oxalic acid). TREATMENT (SIMILAR TO METHANOL POSIONING) • Gastric lavage, sodium bicarbonate (to combat acidosis), calcium gluconate (to correct hypocalcemia) • Ethanol or 4 methyl pyrazole (fomepizole) as antidote • Hemodialysis in cases of severe poisoning. PM APPEARANCE • Oxalate crystals are seen in the brain, spinal cord and kidneys (Note: Metabolic acidosis also seen with methanol but calcium oxalate crystals with renal failure are characteristic of Ethylene glycol)

questions.text: A person was brought dead to the casualty and autopsy was performed to find out the cause of death. The external and internal findings are as shown in picture below. Your possible diagnosis is
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Throttling Ref.: The Essentials of Forensic Medicine & Toxicology, 34th Edition, KSN Reddy, Page No. 329-334/Bernard Knight, Knight’s Forensic Pathology (4thEdn) Pg. 374 Explanation: • Throttling is a type of manual strangulation causing external compression of airway using hands • It is almost always homicidal PM FINDINGS • Contusions on the neck (produced by fingertips) along with linear or cresentic abrasions (produced by nails) • Number and position of contusion depends upon the hands used • Internally, extensive bruising of ncek muscles or ecchymosis of subcutaneous tissues in neck, Inward compression (adduction) fracture of hyoid bone and fracture of superior horn of thyroid cartilage and Cricoid cartilage ADELSON’S CRITERIA FOR THROTTLING (i)Bilateral skin trauma (ii)Subjacent soft tissue hemorrhage (iii)Laryngeal/hyoid injuries

questions.text: Jack knife position causes death due to
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Traumatic asphyxia Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 341/ KrishanVij; TB of FMT, 5thEd. Page No.118 Explanation:Jack Knife position is an Indirect compression of chest caused when victim’s thighs and knees are driven against the chest thus preventing respiratory movements.It is a form of traumatic asphyxia. TRAUMATIC ASPHYXIA: Traumatic asphyxia is defined as a form of asphyxia resulting from trauma of the chest leading to forceful compression of chest preventing respiratory movements (Note: Many International Authors recognize Jack knife position as Positional or postural asphyxia. However almost all Indian Authors (including the Most Standard Referred Books) consider it as Traumatic Asphyxia. Hence, the answer is marked as such. Other similar books may give different answer. Readers are recommended to use their intellect and judge based on evidences and references provided.

questions.text: An adult came to casualty with complaints of rapid heart rate. On examination everything was normal except for episodic tachycardia and occasional extra systole and amblyopia. Which of the following is the cause of it?
questions.solution: Ans.:A - Nicotine Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed., Page No. 572 Explanation: • Nicotine is a alkaloid present in plant Nicotianatabacum; dried leaves of which are used as tobacco for chewing, smoking and other recreational purposes • It is considered a cardiac poison • In the habitual smoker, nicotine causes amblyopia, narrowing of the field of vision and some blurring, etc • Habitual smoking is reported to lead to tobacco heart-a condition characterised by irregularity, extrasystole and occasional attacks of pain suggesting angina pectoris

questions.text: A young patient had complaintson and off acute abdominal pain and tingling sensation of limbs and at times weakness of limbs. She had a history of eating paint from the wall of newly built house. Which of the following enzyme defect will be the cause of her condition?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - ALA dehydratase Ref.: Lead and ?-Aminolevulinic Acid Dehydratase Polymorphism: Where Does It Lead? A Meta-Analysis (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1797830/) Explanation: LEAD POISONING • It manifests as changes in personality, restlessness, hyperkinetic and aggressive behaviour, fatigability, mental dullness, learning disorders, refusal to play, headache, insomnia, vomiting, raised intracranial pressure, papilledema, visual disturbances and irritability • The habit of licking the paint is a PICA plus the source of lead poisoning PICA associated with plumbism is due to anemia caused by lead • Lead inhibits heme synthesis through inhibition of delta ALA-dehydratase, ferrochelatase, porphobilinogen synthase, co-proporphyrinogen oxidase and other enzymes, resulting in the build-up of aminolevulinic acid, coproporphyrins and free erythrocyte protoporphyrin. • It also inhibits enzyme pyrimidine 5’-nucleotidase, thus increasing erythrocyte fragility. • The child exhibits manifestations of the Lead encephalopathy which is common in children.

questions.text: Black foot disease is seen in which poisoning?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Arsenic Ref.:https://www.drpareshmajumder.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=101&Itemid=96 Explanation- Blackfoot disease is an endemic peripheral vascular disease found among the inhabitants of a limited area on the southwest coast of Tai wan, where artesian well water with a high concentration of arsenichas been used for more than eighty years.

questions.text: Match the given drugs of abuse with their correct street names:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) A-ii, B-iv, C-i, D-iii -Cocaine is also known as coke, snow, Cadillac and white lady. -LSD Post-hallucinogen Perception Disease is a chronic perceptual disorder that causes the sufferer to frequently feel as though he is submerged in a bubble of "purple haze" and that lights and pictures are trailing behind him. -Other names of Abrus are: Ratti, Gunchi, Jequirity, Crab's eye, Rosary pea -Hunan Hand: Intense burning pain, hyperalgesia, erythema and dermatitis, after handling chili (Capsicum annuum).

questions.text: A teenage girl was found dead in her room. On post-mortem examination the following appearances were found. Image A shows the appearance of neck on external examination. Image B and C show the appearance of nasal orifice with mouth and eye changes respectively. Image 1 and 2 show the findings on neck dissection. Which of the following is the most probable cause of death in this case?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Throttling Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 330 Explanation- Hanging and ligature strangulation are ruled out as there are no evidence of ligature mark. Marks on the neck and hemorrhagic spots in the neck region in neck dissection very well suggestive of throttling.

choices.text: Vaginal swab need not be taken
The fetus can be aborted after her consent
Examination can be done by a male doctor with a female attendant
Urine pregnancy test is not necessary

questions.text: A 14-years-old rape victim was brought to the hospital with 22 weeks of pregnancy. All of the following are correct statements regarding the case, except:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Vaginal swab need not be taken Ref.: Reddy, The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 374 Explanation: • Option C is obvious. • Urine pregnancy test is not necessary. • Fetus can be terminated, as it is after 22 weeks of pregnancy.

questions.text: A middle aged lady was found in a robbed room lying in a pool of blood. On forensic examination, there was an entry wound of size around 1x1 cm on the left temporal region with tattooing and blackening around the wound. There was also an exit wound with bevelling at the right temporal region. On further examination, two bullet fragments were found inside the brain parenchyma. Which of the following could be used to determine the distance from which the weapon was fired?
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Hair Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 210-213 Explanation: 'Bullet fragments’ found inside the brain tell us that a rifled firearm was used rather than a shotgun. Generally, clothes and skin around the wound is preserved to determine the range. Tattooing and blackening indicates that it is a near shot. But if singeing of hair is present, then we can say that it is a close shot.

questions.text: Atropine is not an antidote in:
questions.solution: Ans.: B - Endrin Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 484-489 Explanation:Endrin is an organochloride pesticide which causes neurotoxicity. There is no antidote available and hence only symptomatic treatment is done. Parathion and TIK-20 are organophosphates, and Baygon is a combination of organophosphate and carbamate; for all of these atropine is the drug of choice for poisoning.

choices.text: Eyelid, facial muscles, upper limb, thorax

questions.text: According to Nysten’s rule what is the correct sequence of setting in of rigor mortis.
questions.solution: Ans.: A - Eyelid, neck & jaw, face, thorax Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 152 Explanation:In Voluntary muscles order of appearance of rigor mortis is eyelids, neck&jaw, face, thorax, upper limbs, abdomen, lower limbs and finger & toes.¬

questions.text: A person is criminally not responsible for his actions if at the time of doing it by reason of unsoundness of mind, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to the law.
questions.solution: Ans.: A - McNaughten’s rule Ref.: Reddy: The Essentials of FMT, 34th Ed. Page No. 459 Explanation:McNnaughten’s rule states that “To establish a defence on the ground of insanity, it must be clearly proved that, at the time of the committing of the act, the party accused was labouring under such a defect of reason, from disease of the mind, as not to know the nature and quality of the act he was doing; or, if he did know it, that he did not know he was doing what was wrong”

questions.text: Match the given declarations with their respective intended purposes
questions.solution: Ans.: B A-ii, B-iv, C-iii, D-i Explanation: 1. Declaration of Geneva = Hippocratic oath 2. Declaration of Oslo = Therapeutic abortion 3. Declaration of Tokyo = Torture 4. Declaration of Helsinki = Human experimentation 5. Declaration of Istanbul= Organ trafficking 6. Declaration of Sydney= Brain death 7. Declaration of Malta= Hunger strike

To tell or discuss with colleagues that she is a case of abuse
To call local social worker for help

questions.text: A 16-years-old girl comes to a doctor with fractured forearm. She told she tripped and fell but cigarette burns were observed on her forearm. What will be your next step?
questions.solution: Ans.B • First step is to do a complete physical examination and ascertain that it is a case on battered baby syndrome or non accidental injury of childhood. •Next step is to make it an MLC. Irrespective of consent of child or guardians. Suppose if female doesn’t let the doctor do complete physical examination, then we must inform the higher authorities first

questions.text: “First-hand knowledge” refers to-
questions.solution: Ans. C First hand knowledge is one the one gained directly by our senses.

questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Aconite also called Meetha Zaher , Monkhood , blue rocket, Horse radish root . - All parts of plant are poisonous. - Classical sign in aconite poisoning: Alternate constriction &dilation of pupil is called Hippus Sign. - Xanthopsia : Yellow halo surrounding object. Symptoms : Numbness /Tingling over tongue , mouth &Skin. - It is a cardiac poison and causes AV block , Bradycardia . Atropine is used in the treatment of its toxicity.

questions.text: Match the following columns-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) - Heroine : Derivative of Morphine (Diacetylmorphine) Street name of heroine : Junk, Dope , Brown sugar & Smack. Fatal dose : 50 g - Indian Blister Beetle : It is known as Spanish Fly. Fatal dose : 15 to 30g Symptoms: Priapism - Arbus Precautions : It is also called Gunja , Jequirity, Ratti , Rosary Bead , Indian liquorice Fatal dose: 1-2 seeds or 90-120 mg of Abrine. -Aconite : Also called Meetha Zaher , Monkhood , Blue rocket , Horse - radish root Fatal dose : 1g

questions.text: Match the following columns-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) -Adipocere: Adipocere appears as white , moist , greasy ( look like Rancid butter). -Postmortem Hypostasis: Postmortem hypostasis appears as a purplish-red discoloration of the skin and is usually found on the parts of the body that have come in contact with the ground. -Mummification: Mummification : In dry hot climate , Dehydration/Dessication of the body .. Odourless. -Marbling of Skin After Death: Marbling of the skin after death is often caused by severe dehydration and exposure to extreme temperatures. It appears as a striking discoloration of the skin, with distinct lines and patterns that are reminiscent of marble.

questions.text: Poisoning by which of these element causes blind staggers alkali disease in livestock?
questions.solution: Ans. C The animal becomes blind and has a staggering gait in the condition of chronic selenium poisoning. It is also associated with hairloss.

choices.text: Hospital administration is responsible for the actions of interns and trainees
A nurse assisting a surgery is a borrowed servant of the hospital
Doctor assisting a surgeon for fee in OT

questions.text: All are true about Doctrine of borrowed servant except-
questions.solution: Ans. B A nurse assisting a surgery is a borrowed servant of the surgeon. She is an employee of the hospital. All the other options points towards vicarious liability. Borrowed servant doctrine is a part of vicarious liability.

questions.text: A 14-years-old female was claimed to be kidnapped, on interrogation she claims that she is not a minor and left home with the person on her own will. Court ordered for her age estimation. Given below are the X-rays of pelvis, wrist and bilateral elbow. What is her most probable age based on these?
questions.solution: Ans. D • All the centres around the elbow have ossified. They ossify in around 16 yrs in male and 15 yrs in female • All the centres around wrist joint have ossified suggesting age to be .17 YRS • Ischial tuberosity has ossified and so the age must be around 21 to 22 yrs.

questions.text: Calculate the Age of fetus having CRL 23 cm, foot length 7 cm. Talus is present and testes are present at superficial inguinal ring?
questions.solution: Ans. C Crown rump length (CRL) = 2/3 of Crown heal length (CHL) 23= 2/3 CHL CHL= 35 Morrisons formula for age estimation Age = length /5 = 35/5 = 7 months

questions.text: All are the features present in male skull as compared to female skull except-
questions.solution: Ans. D

questions.text: Upto what time if a rape victim. complaints., the examination is done?
questions.solution: Ans: B Vaginal swabs are taken froma rape victim within 4 days. Best answer here is 3 days

questions.text: A 30-year-old person presented to the OPD with the below finding. Which of the following conditions do you see them
questions.solution: Ans: B Arsenic is a metallic irritant with lethal dose 0.1 to 0.2g. Skin manifestations of arsenic poisoning include • Hyperkeratosis • Rain drop pigmentation • Basal cell carcinoma • Aldrich mees lines on nails

questions.text: According to Indian medical council act, the hospital records must be returned within
questions.solution: Ans: C Factual question

questions.text: Identify the type of injury in the below image
questions.solution: Ans: A Abrasion damages only epidermis. Degloving injury is called flaying or avulsion laceration.

questions.text: Bullet fingerprinting, bullet is identified by?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) When a bullet is fired, it passes through the rifled barrel of the gun, which has spiral grooves and lands. These grooves leave distinct marks (called rifling marks) on the surface of the bullet. These marks are unique to each firearm due to: Imperfections in the barrel. The manufacturing process of the firearm. These rifling marks are used to match a bullet to a specific gun, making them the "fingerprint" of the firearm. Forensic ballistics experts analyze these marks to identify the weapon used to fire the bullet, which is the primary basis for bullet fingerprinting. Option A. Primary character: Explanation: The term "primary character" is not specific to forensic ballistics or bullet identification. There is no concept of "primary character" used in the context of bullet fingerprinting. Therefore, it is not a correct option for identifying bullets. Option B. Secondary marking: Explanation: "Secondary markings" could refer to external marks left on the bullet when it contacts other surfaces (e.g., the casing or during handling). These are not the unique ballistic markers used for identifying the firearm. Secondary markings are not as specific or reliable for identification compared to rifling marks left by the barrel of the gun. Option C. Range of firearm: Explanation: The range of the firearm refers to how far a bullet travels when fired and is more relevant in determining shooting distance or ballistic trajectory. While this information can help in crime scene reconstruction, it does not help in identifying a bullet or matching it to a firearm, making this option irrelevant in bullet fingerprinting.

questions.text: Aggressive sexual assault in penetration in POSCO act are all except?
questions.solution: Ans: C POCSO act 2012 tells about 4 conditions 1. Penetrative sexual aassault 2. Aggravated penetrative sexual assault 3. Sexual assault 4. Aggravated sexual assault Aggravated penetrative sexual assault is when force is involved orwhen there is involvement of authority, gang or occurring in course of communal violence

questions.text: Identify the type of base of skull fracture in the below image
questions.solution: Ans: B Hinge # - Fracture line runs across the middle cranial fossa and pituitary fossa dividing the base of the skull in to two. -Seen when motorcyclists land on the road china first (motorcyclist's #). Also in boxers

questions.text: 18 year old girl was brought to the OPD. On examination she had untorn hymen, flabby labia minora, labia majora separated, fourchette tear present and a roomy vaginal cavity is
questions.solution: Ans: B Pseudo virgin is a female who has preformed sexual intercourse but hymen is intact. Most important sign of defloration / loss of virginity is dialatation of vaginal canal

questions.solution: Ans: A This image shows suggilation and areas of contact flattening

questions.text: A female found dead in her bedroom, unlocked room. Investigations later showed her blood value of alcohol 350mg/dl. The image is as shown below. Your most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans: A Throttling Unlocked room suggests homicide. Blood alcohol levels 350mg/dl is not fatal. Café coronary ruled out as there is no food particle shown in the image. Hence the answer becomes throttling

choices.text: Keep scale for measuring below the mark & take camera at the level of injury for capturing photo
Complete description of injury as seen
Apply vinyl polysiloxane and look for reaction

questions.text: On external examination, you find concentric teeth bite mark on forearm, you will do all of the following procedures except
questions.solution: Ans: D Whenever a bite mark is found, following steps must be followed 1. Examine and describe the injury 2. Photographs of the bite marks are taken along with scale 3. Saliva is collected using a wet swab and a dry swab 4. Apply vinyl poly siloxane to prepare a cast ( not to look for the reaction). This cast is used to compare bite mark with bite mark of accused

questions.text: Itai-itai disease is caused by:
questions.solution: Ans. B Itai- Itai disease is also known as ouch-ouch disease which is caused by cadmium poisoning . cadmium is a nephrotoxic drug affecting PCT.

questions.text: Bolam’s test is used in:
questions.solution: Ans. C Bolam tests talks about the culpability of a doctor. If focuses upon standard of care given by the doctor. If a doctor has to be held negligent, then the efficiency of care has to be decided by a school of doctors.

questions.text: Poroscopy term coined by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) -Edmond locard is famous for his theory of exchange or Locard's exchange Principle. - This theory states that every contact leaves a trace. When two objects come into contact with one another , each will take something from the other object or leave something behind. - Locard is also renowned for his contribution to the improvement of Dactylography , an area of study that deals with fingerprints. He developed the science of poroscopy ,the study of fingerprint pores , and the impressions produced by these pores.

questions.text: A-10-years old girl was admitted in ER with history of ingesting 10 crushed seeds of a plant, she couldn’t recall how much she had and her ECG looks like this (Figure). Probable cause is___.
questions.solution: Ans. C Yellow oleander is the onky cardiac poison gven among the options. It causes symptoms like dryness of mouth and throat, burning sensation in mouth, purging, tingling ,umbness, loss of musclular power and faintin. The pulse is rapid and irregular, and Bp is low. It finally leads to heart block.

questions.text: Patient died during surgery/under anesthesia, which section among here applies for the surgeon?
questions.solution: Ans. C

questions.text: What is the earliest definite site of external putrefaction?
questions.solution: Ans. C Greeb=nish discolouration is seen 1st in right iliac fossa which is the anatomical position of caecum. It is seen about12 to 18 hrs after death. It is seen due to formation of sulphmethehemoglobin.

questions.text: Exhumation is done following court order. Only skull bone was found with basiocciput fused with basisphenoid. What is the approximate age?
questions.solution: Ans. A Fusion of the spheno-occipital synchondrosis initiates in girls at 12-13 years, and in boys at 14-15 years and is complete by 17-18 years. Fusion begins superiorly and progresses inferiorly, and also starts at the inner surface of the skull base proceeding towards the ectocranial surface

questions.text: What is living will?
questions.solution: Ans. C Living will is a written consent given prior to incapacitation. This is introduced after a judgment in 2018 regarding euthanasia. It is a kind of advanced directive.

questions.text: Enblock dissection and organ separation are done by:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) • Virchows technique is individual organ dissection • Letulles is an enmasse technique • Rokitansky is insitu dissection • Gohns is enblock dissection

questions.text: Wound debridement is done by which of the following maggots.

questions.text: What is the type of wound shown in the below picture?
questions.solution: Ans: C Abrasions damage only the epidermis. Incised wound and acerated wound are 3 dimensional injuries and expose the tissue below the skin. Puncture wound is a type of stab wound.

questions.text: A middle aged women comes to the hospital with symptoms and signs suggestive of malignancy. The resident doctors made a presumptive diagnosis of malignancy but needs to confirm it with investigations. They were hesitant to inform to the patient and the relatives to avoid unnecessary chaos. What ethical principle did the resident doctors use here.
questions.solution: Ans: B Beneficence is defined as an act of charity, mercy, and kindness with a strong connotation of doing good to others including moral obligation. All professionals have the foundational moral imperative of doing right

questions.text: Palatoprint obtained from which part of hard palate?
questions.solution: Ans: A palatoprints is study of laterally extended curved ridges (rugae) and the grooves on the anterior part of palate. It is also called Rugoscopy

questions.text: BAL is used as an antidote in the poisoning due to which among the following?
questions.solution: Ans: A C E Ref: Reddy 33rdEd, KDT 7th Ed Explanation: Dimercaprol/BAL is used as an antidote in poisoning by • Gold (Au) • Copper (Cu) • Bismuth (Bi) • Arsenic (As) • Antimony (Sb) • Nickel (Ni) • Mercury (Hg) BAL is contraindicated in iron and cadmium poisoning

questions.text: Miosis can be caused by which among the following poisons?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B, C) Ref: Reddy 33rd Ed/619 Explanation: Aconite, Dhatura and Cyanide produce mydriasis, not miosis.

questions.text: Punishment for insulting the modesty of a woman is covered by which among the following?
questions.solution: Ans 3: E Ref: Reddy 33rd Ed Explanation:

questions.text: The cephalic index of Indian population is?
questions.solution: Ans : C Ref: Reddy 30th Ed/52 Explanation: Cephalic index: Max breadth of skull/Max length of skull X 100. In Indians, , Skull is Mesaticephalic with CI of 75-80.

questions.text: Sui needles used to kill animals is made of which among the following?
questions.solution: Ans: C Ref: Parikh Textbook Explanation: Sin needle used to kill animals is made of Ratti seeds/Abrusprecatorius

choices.text: Cannot differentiate between antemortem and postmortem burns
Indicate defence and struggle of victim during antemortem death

questions.text: True statement(s) regarding pugilistic attitude is/are?
questions.solution: Ans: C D Ref: Reddy 31st Ed Explanation: Pugilistic attitude(Boxing/fencing/defense attitude/Heat stiffening) • Occurs on exposure to extensive heat with stiffening and flexion of all joints and clawing of fingers, known as pugilistic or boxer's or defense posture', due to denaturation and coagulation ofproteins. • Contraction ofparanasal sinuses causes marked opisthotonus. • However, heat stiffening is permanent (unlike rigor-mortis which passes off after few hours) • It occurs in both antemortem and postmortem burns. So difficult to differentiate between the two.

questions.text: Bolam test is related to?
questions.solution: Ans: B Ref: Modern Tort Law 6th Ed Explanation: The Bolam Test A test that arose from English tort law, which is used to assess medical negligence. Bolam holds thatthe law imposes a duty of care between a doctor and his patient, but the standard of that care is a matter of medicaljudgement. Under Bolam, the plaintiff seeking to prove medical negligence needs to (1) show that there was a duty of care between thedoctor or nurse and the patient, which is usually a straightforward exercise, and (2) that the act or omission of the doctor ornurse breached the duty of care. In Bolam v Friern Hospital Management Committee [1957], the court held that there is nobreach of standard of care if responsible body of similar professionals support the practice that caused the injury, even ifthe practice was not the standard of care. The ruling meant that the accused doctor need only to find an expert who wouldtestify to having done the same thing. Thus, Bolam was criticised for its overreliance on medical testimony and personaljudgement of experts chosen by the defendant.

choices.text: Post-mortem lividity is fixed at 6-8 hr
Delayed rigor mortis in cholera and strychnine poisoning
Rigor mortis seen with ATP falling upto 85% of the normal
Cadavaeric spasm is seen instantaneously at the time of death
Postmortem caloricity occurs after 5 to 6 hr of death

questions.text: Not true regarding post-mortem changes is/are?
questions.solution: Ans: B E Ref: Reddy 31st Ed Explanation: Rigor mortis appears early and passes quickly in TB, cholera and strychnine poisoning. Post mortem caloricity occurs for 1st 2-3 hr after death. Other options are correct

choices.text: Variable fractures at the multiple sites

questions.text: Child abuse is indicated by all of the following except?

questions.text: Article 246, schedule 7 of the Indian constitution deals with?
questions.solution: Ans: A B C D E This article deals with the following lists • List 1 : union list : in which only the central government can make laws. Example: higher education and port quarantine. • List 2: state list: in which only state can make laws. Example: sanitation and hospital management • List 3: concurrent list: in which both center and state can make laws. Example: food adulteration.

choices.text: Caused by friction of the projectile
Can be seen due to hanging

questions.text: True statement(s) regarding abrasion collar is/are?
questions.solution: Ans: A, C • An entry wound of riffled forearm contains: a central entry wound for bullet, surrounded by grease collar, this is surrounded by abrasion collar. Abrasion collar is formed due to friction between rotatory movement of bullet with skin. • In very rare cases, abrasion collar may be present at exit wound of riffled arms. Such wounds are known as shored exit wound. It is seen when the skin is tightly supported at the exit.

questions.text: Persistent rigidity after death is seen in?
questions.solution: Ans: B C D • Persistent rigidity is seen in cases of: rigor mortis, cadaveric spasm, cold stiffening, heat stiffening, due to gases. • Suicide by firearms may or may not cause persistent rigidity.

questions.text: All are true about abrus precatorius except?
questions.solution: Ans: B • Abrus precatorius is also known as ratti, gunchi, Indian liquorice • It contains abrin and abraline. It resembles viper venom in action • It is used for sui formation , cattle poison and an abortifacient.

questions.text: X-ray suited for age estimation between 16-17 years?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B D E) - Patella : 14 years - Xiphoid : 40 years -Iliac Crest : 20 years - Inner end of Clavicle : 21 years - Ischial tuberosity : 22 years - shoulder joint : 18 years - Elbow joint : 16 years - Wrist joint : 18 years - Upper end of femur : 16 years - Lower end of femur &upper end of tibia :18 years - Lower end of tibia &Fibula : 16 years -Hyoid bone (Greater cornu) : 40-60 years - All sacra vertebrae forms a single bone : 21-25 years

questions.text: True regarding dactylography?
questions.solution: Ans: A D • Dactylography is much better and lmost absolute method of identification. • 8 points should match to say that the fingerprints are of the same person. Best finger used is left thumb • Both little fingers are not considered.

questions.text: In Indian judiciary which of the following represents Mc Naughten’s rule?
questions.solution: A Mc Naughten’s rule states that that every man is to be presumed to be sane, and ... that to establish a defence on the ground of insanity, it must be clearly proved that, at the time of the committing of the act, the party accused was labouring under such a defect of reason, from disease of the mind, as not to know the nature and quality of the act he was doing; or if he did know it, that he did not know he was doing what was wrong

questions.text: All of the following articles are related to child rights except?
questions.solution: C • Article 45: Provision of free and compulsory education for children • Article 24: Prohibition of employment of children in factories • Article 39: deals with health and strength of workers, men and women and tender age of children are not abused and that children are given opportunities and facilities to develop in a healthy manner

questions.text: Locard in forensic medicine is famous for?
questions.solution: A Locard’s principle of exchange states that “ whenever two objects come in contact with each other, there is always exchange of materials”

questions.text: Which of the following causes bluish discoloration of stomach?
questions.solution: D Bluish discolouration of stomach caused by • Copper sulphate : blue vitriol • Barbiturates capsule contains sodium amytal • Dextropropoxyphene poisoning

questions.text: Which of the following is first to putrefy?
questions.solution: C First organ to putrefy is larynx and trachea. Among the given options it is brain.

questions.text: A patient presented with muscle pain and proximal tubular damage of nephrons. Which of the following is likely cause?
questions.solution: D Almost all heavy metals are nephrotoxic in nature. Predominantly mercury and cadmium are known for nephrotoxic effects. Mercury causes glomerulous membranous nephropathy. Mercury accumulates in muscles and joints causing myalgia, joint stiffness and pains

choices.text: Born after death of both parent

questions.text: Posthumous child is-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Posthumous child is a child born without a father.

questions.text: Which of the following is first affected in rigor mortis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) First affected in rigor morits are involuntary muscles ie myocardium. This is followed by voluntary muscles. The first voluntary muscle involved is upper eyelid followed by neck>jaw> face> thorax> abdomen> lower limbs.

questions.text: Punishment for perjury is defined under section
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Punishment for perjury can be upto 7 years. Perjury is defined under sec 191 IPC. Punishment for pejury is defined under sec 193 IPC.

questions.text: Gastric lavage is not contraindicated after ingestion of
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Gastric lavage can be done after ingestion of carbolic acid/ phenol because carbolic acid causes leathery stomach with no risk of perforation. It is contraindicated in corrosive poisoning

questions.text: Viscera in toxicology is stored in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Best preservative for viscera is Rectified spirit. The most common preservative used is saturated sodium chloride solution.

questions.text: Identical twins will not have the same
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Fingerprints are said to be better than DNA finger prints in identification.

questions.text: In alleged history of gun shot injury, there is burning, blackening, tattooing around the wound, dirt collar. The injury is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Singing, blackening and tattooing is seen in entry wound. Since no contact or no muzzle imprint seen, it is a close shot entry from riffle.

questions.text: A child is having battered baby syndrome. How will you identify
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) -Battered baby syndrome is also called as Caffey syndrome. -Baby is abused Physically by guardian or parent repeatedly. - History given by parents and physical findings on the baby's body are inconsistent. Laceration of mucosa in the inner aspect of upper lip with frenulum - Characteristic lesion. Butterfly shaped bruises. - Multiple injuries of various durations seen . - Skull fracture - Eggshell fracture - Metaphyseal fracture of long bone : Bucket handle / Corner fracture - Traumatic alopecia - Multiple rib fractures: String of beds appearance/Nobbing alopecia. - Most common cause of death in battered baby syndrome is Head injury > Rupture of abdominal organs.

questions.text: Degloving skin involves removal of?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Subcutaneous fat removed from underlying fascia is known as degloving/ avulsion laceration/ flaying. Degloving injury is characterized by loss of skin , subcutaneous tissue with intact fascia.
